node.display_long_description:
Star Trek™: Bridge Crew will immerse you in the Star Trek universe thanks to VR. The game puts you and your friends in the heart of the U.S.S. Aegis.
Your mission: explore a largely uncharted sector of space known as The Trench, in hopes of locating a suitable new home world for the decimated Vulcan populace. The Klingon Empire is also active in the region, and their purpose is a threat to the Federation’s plans. 

Make strategic decisions and coordinate actions with your crew to complete the mission. 
In co-op, you can form a crew of four players to serve in the roles of Captain, Helm, Tactical and Engineer. In addition to a dynamic storyline, the game features an “Ongoing Missions” mode, procedurally generating missions for countless hours of Solo and Co-op adventure. 
  
Uplay account required.
A permanent internet connection is required in order to play the game.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
•	Ubiservices SDK Update
•	Improved User hands alignment
•	Improved text readability
•	Improved distorted beeps in several areas in the game
•	Improved map objectives location markers
•	Fixed LOD on Android hands

node.reviewDescription:
Currently on a Quest 2, this game is almost unplayable. I’d say only 10% of the online games I play I can complete an entire mission. Often times controls are not responsive, other players voices cuts out, no one can hear you, or other players are no louder than the quietest whisper. This game is incredible for Star Trek fans like me, and is the epitome of a dream come true. However, it is nearly impossible to enjoy in its current state. In other recent reviews, I have seen Ubisoft support staff asking reviewers who have encountered these problems to record and document them, and send them over to be looked at and fixed. Instead of this since they’re not rare problems, Ubisoft should just play one game to diagnose these game breaking issues! Lastly, Ubisoft should stop giving Bridge Crew community members false hope for this game by continually saying they are fixing the issues. Either tell us this game is completely abandoned or  not, and quit giving the community false hope. Please Ubisoft, tell us what the situation is with the game. I can’t change my star review until this happens.
Update: Upon seeing the quick response by Ubisoft staff to this review, I have updated my review to 3 stars. I was impressed by the promptness and in depth answer showing that the game is not abandoned. I hope these glitches and bugs get worked out quickly, and when they do I will again revise this review. Thank you Ubisoft and please fix these soon!

developerResponse.body:
Hello there, Ricopello! We are terribly sorry that you continue to experience these issues and that it seems like this player insight is going unnoticed. I assure you that our teams are aware of the issues at hand. We are gathering feedback from players so that we can develop permanent fixes that allow our players to continue enjoying Star Trek Bridge Crew. Currently, we have only found the provided workarounds, but we are continuing to work diligently towards more solutions for this situation. For updates regarding this, we recommend that you stay tuned to our forums here! 
>>https://forums.ubisoft.com/forumdisplay.php/1348-Player-Support

website_page_meta.description: Developed specifically for VR, Star Trek: Bridge Crew puts you and your friends in the heart of a starship where, as officers of the Federation, every action and decision you make together will determine the fate of your ship and crew.
website_page_meta.title: Star Trek: Bridge Crew · Oculus Quest
